tool.name: cramtools BAM to CRAM
tool.description: cramtools converting BAM to CRAM format
tool.command:
@PREPROCESS_FASTA_FILE@
java -jar \$CRAMTOOLS_ROOT_DIR/jars/cramtools-3.0.jar cram -l INFO
#if $capture_tags.select == "all_tags": --capture-all-tags #else --capture-tags "${capture_tags.tags}" #end if
$preserve_read_names $lossless_quality_score
#if str($input_alignment.ext) == 'sam': --input-is-sam #end if
-I $input_alignment -R "${reference_source.input_reference}.fa" -O $output_alignment

param.name: select
param.label: Do you want to filter on BAM/SAM/CRAM tags?
param.option: Yes, I want use a subset of tags

param.name: tags
param.label: Capture the tags listed, for example 'OQ:XA:XB'
param.help: For more details on these tags take a look at the sam/bam specification https://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/. Because aligners may come with their own non-standard tags, please read the manual of your aligner carefully.

param.name: preserve_read_names
param.label: Preserve original read names
param.help: Removal of such names saves disk space

param.name: lossless_quality_score
param.label: Do a lossless base quality compression
param.help: Lossy base quality score compression saves disk space but has a lower resolution

tool.help:
**What this tool does**
Converts alignments from the BAM format to the CRAM format. The CRAM format does additional compression relative to the reference genome which makes the compression in terms of file size more effictient.
